title: Lajatang of Order
data:
{{version031}} {{flavour|A silver-bladed lajatang, once bestowed upon a favoured worshipper of Zin. It became the most prized weapon of the many priests of Zin. After their order was destroyed, it fell into disuse and vanished from history.}} [[File:Lajatang_of_Order.png]] '''''the +7 lajatang of Order''''' +7 [[lajatang]] [[Silver]] brand
[[Mutation resistance]] (66% chance to resist hostile mutations.) ==Desirability== The '''lajatang of Order'''{{source ref|0.31.0|art-data.txt|1374}} is a good weapon, with high damage output in general, and outstanding damage against [[:Category:Silver vulnerability|silver-vulnerable]] enemies. Just as impressive is the fact that it is one of a few sources of [[mutation resistance]] (ironically, this also makes it much less desirable for actual worshipers of [[Zin]]). This weapon largely follows the same benefits and pitfalls as a regular lajatang; it offers great damage for low skill, in exchange for requiring 2 [[hand]]s and comparatively low late-game damage. Hybrids might like this weapon, but a heavy melee brute may prefer another weapon. Regardless, it can be used as a swapout against monsters who cast [[Malmutate]] (all of which are chaotic, and will thus suffer heavy damage from the silver brand). ==History== *Prior to [[0.24]], the [[silver]] brand offered no damage bonus to monsters not vulnerable to silver. *Prior to [[0.18]], rMut provided a 90% chance to resist hostile mutations. But there were [[amulet of resist mutation|amulets of resist mutation]] in the game, which also provided this resistance, so having rMut was less special. *The lajatang of Order was added in [[0.14]]. ==References== [[Category:Unrands]] [[Category:Staves]] [[Category:Magical staves]]
